result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah J McCarty

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah J McCarty in court.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Jeremiah J McCarty.  Attorney Tomas Valerio for Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties request PTC. Outstanding Court of Appeals decision pending that could affect resolution of case.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-Trial Services change in supervision report
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties discussing Veteran's Treatment Court.  Requesting PTC

Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties not ready to proceed with plea today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

11:14 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Attorney Tomas Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:41 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
